question: How to route high-speed clocks in dynamically reconfigurable FPGA designs?
options: Staggered routing of high-speed clock signals to balance the transmission path and introduce distributed feedback conditioning devices in each area
Adopt a hierarchical clock tree structure to introduce logical isolation units when crossing multiple power domains to reduce the risk of noise propagation
Use equal length cabling to ensure that cross-zone connections do not cross the split power layer and avoid noise injection
The clock synchronization ability is enhanced by introducing redundant routing paths to reduce the influence of reconstructed regional interference on the global timing
None of the above options are correct
